reasoning: Pigmentary retinal dystrophy encompasses inherited retinal degenerative disorders, primarily retinitis pigmentosa. Incidence ~1-2 per 100k person-years with prevalence ~50 per 100k. Used both metrics as literature reports both incidence of new diagnoses and prevalence of affected population. Moderate confidence due to rare disease status and limited population-based data.
source: Berson EL. (1993). Retinitis pigmentosa. The Friedenwald Lecture. Invest Ophthalmol Vis Sci. 34(5):1659-1676
